intro: Oenanthe maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hairy stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Oenanthe maroccana is often found in moist habitats such as marshes and stream banks.
